\]

\[
\det(A - \lambda I) = 0
\]

Where \( A \) is the given matrix, \( \lambda \) represents the eigenvalues, and \( I \) is the identity matrix.

Substitute the values into the equation:

\[
\begin{vmatrix}
13 - \lambda & 2 & -18 \\

\end{vmatrix}
= 0
\]

Expanding the determinant:

\[

\]

Solving this equation will give us the eigenvalues.

* "Lo tig'a!" (Do not touch!) emphasizes the harshness of the prohibition.

* "Matzevot b'makom shoshanim" (Tombstones in place of lilies) creates a strong contrast between life and death.
